law.catch_line: Except as provided in subsections (b) and (c) of this section, this subtitle does not apply to:...

text.section:
Except as provided in subsections (b) and (c) of this section, this subtitle does not apply to:
a public body when it is carrying out:
an administrative function;
a judicial function; or
a quasi-judicial function; or
a chance encounter, social gathering, or other occasion that is not intended to circumvent this subtitle.

The provisions of this subtitle apply to a public body when it is meeting to consider:
granting a license or permit; or
a special exception, variance, conditional use, zoning classification, the enforcement of any zoning law or regulation, or any other zoning matter.

If a public body recesses an open session to carry out an administrative function in a meeting that is not open to the public, the minutes for the public body's next meeting shall include:
a statement of the date, time, place, and persons present at the administrative function meeting; and
a phrase or sentence identifying the subject matter discussed at the administrative function meeting.
